info.title: Pact REST API
info.description: Transactional API for a runtime offering Pact smart contracts.

servers.description: Pact API for a chain on the Kadena mainnet.
Pact API for a chain on the Kadena testnet.

post.description:
Blocking/sync call to submit a command for non-transactional execution. In a
blockchain environment this would be a node-local “dirty read”, which can
either serve as a node-local repl execution, or fully gassed transaction
simulation and transaction validation. Any database writes or changes to the
environment are rolled back.

parameters.name: preflight
parameters.description:
Trigger fully-gassed mainnet transaction execution simulation and
transaction metadata validations.

parameters.name: rewindDepth
parameters.description:
Rewind transaction execution environment by a number of block
heights.

parameters.name: signatureValidation
parameters.description:
Require user signature validation when validating transaction
metadata.

text/plain.example: Validation failed: Invalid command: Failed reading: empty

post.description:
Asynchronous submission of one or more public (unencrypted) commands
to the blockchain for execution.

200.description: The commands were successfully submitted. The response contains their request keys.

requestKeys.description: Request keys for use with `poll` or `listen` to retrieve results.

text/plain.example: Validation failed for hash "j5f3mZaF9pVA7OmV4nTuw5-paG9LzLQJWAMuGGRRLeQ": Attempt to buy gas failed with: (read coin-table sender): Failure: Tx Failed: read: row not found: 368820f80c324bbc7c2b0610688a7da43e39f91d118732671cd9c7500ff43cca

post.description: Allows polling for one or more command results by request key.

200.description: The command results for some of the requested request keys.

post.description: Blocking request for single command result.

Asynchronous submission of a single addressed command which
will be transmitted with end-to-end encryption only between addressed entity nodes.
Private payload metadata required.

requestKeys.description: Request keys for use with `poll` or `listen` to retrieve results.

servers.description: Pact API for a chain on the Kadena mainnet.
Pact API for a chain on the Kadena testnet.

post.description: Blocking request to fetch spv proof of a cross chain transaction. Request must be sent to the chain where the transaction is initiated.

400.description: The requested spv proof was not findable.

text/plain.example: SPV target not reachable: target chain not reachable. Chainweb instance is too young

schema.description: Error message with the description of failed proof requests.

command.title: Pact Command
command.description: Represents a single blockchain Pact transaction.

cmd.description: Stringified JSON `payload` object. Canonic non-malleable signed transaction data.

hash.description:
Unpadded Base64URL of Blake2s-256 hash of the `cmd` field value. Serves as a command
`requestKey` since each transaction must be unique.

sigs.description: List of signatures corresponding one-to-one with `signers` array in the payload.

sig.description:
Base16-encoded cryptograhic signature of `cmd` field data
for corresponding signer in payload.

payload.description:
Pact Command Payloads are encoded as strings in Pact commands, and contain all
non-malleable data for a transaction.

data.description: Arbitrary JSON to be accessed via `read-msg`, `read-integer` et al in Pact code.

oneOf.title: Continuation Message
oneOf.description: Continuation of a previous transaction defpact.

pactId.description: ID of pact running previous step.

rollback.description: Whether to execute a specified rollback on this step.

data.description: Arbitrary JSON to be accessed via `read-msg`, `read-integer` et al in Pact code.

proof.description: Backend-specific data for continuing a cross-chain proof.

chainId.description: Platform-specific chain identifier. For chainweb this is the stringified chain number.

gasLimit.description: Limits total amount of gas to be consumed.

gasPrice.description: Specifies price per gas unit to be charged.

ttl.description: Time in seconds after creation time that transaction can be executed.

creationTime.description: POSIX epoch sending time for transaction.

address.description: Private message envelope address. Required only for private messages, otherwise null.

signers.description: List of signers, corresponding with list of signatures in outer command.

pubKey.description: Public key image. Pact default is base16 ED25519 encoding.

address.description: Address, if any. Pact default expects this to match pubKey.

clist.description: List of capabilities associated with/installed by this signer.

spv-object.description: Object consisting of data required to fetch proof of a cross chain transaction

requestKey.description: Request Key of an initiated cross chain transaction at the source chain.

targetChainId.description: Target chain id of the cross chain transaction.

preflight-result.title: Preflight result
preflight-result.description: The result of attempting to execute a single well-formed Pact /local preflight command.

preflightWarnings.description: A set of deprecation warnings generated as the result of pact command execution.

command-result.title: Command Result
command-result.description: The result of attempting to execute a single well-formed Pact command.

logs.description: Backend-specific value providing image of database logs.

prevBlockHash.description: Parent Block hash of containing block.

creationTime.description: POSIX time the command was created

gasPrice.description: The price of each unit of gas in KDA

continuation.description: Describes result of a defpact execution.

pactId.description: Identifies this defpact execution. On first step generally matches request key.

step.description: Identifies which step executed in defpact.

stepCount.description: Total number of steps in pact.

executed.description: optional value for private pacts, indicates if step was skipped.

stepHasRollback.description: indicates if pact step has rollback.

yield.description: Value yielded during pact step, optionally indicating cross-chain execution.

data.description: Pact value object containing yielded data.

targetChainId.description: Chain ID of target chain for next step.

anyOf.title: String
anyOf.description: Pact strings encode directly to JSON strings.

anyOf.title: Decimal
anyOf.description: There are two alternative JSON representations for Decimal.

oneOf.title: Number
oneOf.description: JSON numbers can be used whenever the precision is adequate

oneOf.title: Object
oneOf.description: When JSON number precision is not enough, you can use an object with the number's decimal representation as a string

decimal.description: String representation of number to avoid rounding error

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: There are two alternative JSON representations for Integer.

oneOf.title: Number
oneOf.description: JSON numbers are rounded to integer values.

oneOf.title: String
oneOf.description: When JSON number precision is not enough, you can specify the integer as a string

anyOf.title: Boolean
anyOf.description: JSON booleans encode to Pact booleans.

anyOf.title: Object
anyOf.description: JSON objects not matching other Pact Value schemas become Pact objects.

time.description: Literal time value using the UTC time format.

anyOf.title: Module Reference
anyOf.description: Special pact value to directly reference a module or interface.

anyOf.title: Guard
anyOf.description: Special pact value for guard types.

oneOf.title: Keyset
oneOf.description:
A keyset forms a rule made from a set of key/address values and a predicate function.
When enforced, transaction signer list is evaluated against keyset.

keys.description: Set of public key/address values. Native pact public keys are ED25519 in base16 encoding.

pred.description:
A pact function name. Built-in values are `keys-all` (match all keys in set),
`keys-any` (match at least one), and `keys-2` (match at least 2).
Custom functions have a fully-qualified name and
must accept two integer arguments `count` (number of keys in set) and `matched`
(number of set keys found in transaction set).

oneOf.title: Keyset Reference
oneOf.description: Refers to a keyset in the Pact environment/database installed with `define-keyset`.

oneOf.title: User Guard
oneOf.description: Closure of call to "guard function" which is a boolean user function with arguments.

args.description: Argument values to the guard function.

oneOf.title: Module Guard
oneOf.description: Autonomous guard that only allows module code access, or requires module admin.

oneOf.title: Pact Guard
oneOf.description:
Autonomous guard that only allows a particular pact execution, referenced by ID, to pass.
Two executions of the same defpact code result in distinct pact IDs. A pact guard
created inside of this execution will only pass when running that particular pact.

module.description: Qualified module name of event defcap.

request-key.title: Request Key
request-key.description: Unique ID of a pact transaction consisting of its hash.

validation-failure.title: Validation Failure
validation-failure.description: Failure message of unexecuted command due to an invalid gas payer, meta, or other environments.

spv-proof.title: SPV Proof
spv-proof.description: Backend-specific data for continuing a cross-chain proof.

tags.name: endpoint-listen
tags.x-displayName: Blocking listen for single transaction result

tags.name: endpoint-spv
tags.x-displayName: SPV proof creation for cross chain transaction
